metadata.Title: CVE-2021-23017 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
A security issue in nginx resolver was identified, which might allow anattacker who is able to forge UDP packets from the DNS server to cause1-byte memory overwrite, resulting in worker process crash or potentialother impact.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-23017` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

nginx - 1.4.6-1ubuntu3.9+esm2
nginx-common - 1.4.6-1ubuntu3.9+esm2
nginx-core - 1.4.6-1ubuntu3.9+esm2
nginx-extras - 1.4.6-1ubuntu3.9+esm2
nginx-full - 1.4.6-1ubuntu3.9+esm2
nginx-light - 1.4.6-1ubuntu3.9+esm2
nginx-naxsi - 1.4.6-1ubuntu3.9+esm2
nginx-naxsi-ui - 1.4.6-1ubuntu3.9+esm2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: nginx package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.4.6-1ubuntu3.9+esm2').
